sen.j: 杏花戯曲十種（きょうか ぎきょく じっしゅ）は、市川左團次 (2代目)が撰した高島屋 (歌舞伎) 市川左團次のお家芸8種。
sen.e: Kyoka Gikyoku Jusshu refers to the eight specialty plays of Sadanji ICHIKAWA of Takashimaya (kabuki) selected by Sadanji ICHIKAWA the second.
Kyoka Gikyoku Jusshu refers to the eight specialty plays of Sadanji ICHIKAWA of Takashimaya (kabuki) selected by Sadanji ICHIKAWA the second.
Kyoka Gikyoku Jusshu refers to the eight specialty plays of Sadanji ICHIKAWA of Takashimaya (kabuki) selected by Sadanji ICHIKAWA the second.

sen.j: 当初は松莚戯曲十種（しょうえん ぎきょく じっしゅ）といったが、後に二代目左團次の俳名である「杏花」に拠って現行の名称になった。
sen.e: They were originally called Shoen Gikyoku Jisshu, but later they were given the present name derived from "Kyoka," Sadanji the second's Haimyo (the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately).

They were originally called Shoen Gikyoku Jisshu, but later they were given the present name derived from 'Kyoka,' Sadanji the second's Haimyo (the term originally refers to a pen name as a haiku poet, but it also refers to a kabuki actor's offstage name which can be used officially and privately).

sen.j: いずれも新歌舞伎の演目で、岡本綺堂作の演目が6種を占める。
sen.e: All of them are works of Shin Kabuki, and six of them are written by Kido OKAMOTO.
All of them are works of Shin Kabuki, and six of them are written by Kido OKAMOTO.

sen.j: 修善寺物語（しゅぜんじ ものがたり） 岡本綺堂 作
sen.e: "Shuzenji Monogatari" (The Tale of Shuzen-ji Temple) written by Kido OKAMOTO
Shuzenji Monogatari (The Tale of Shuzen-ji Temple) written by Kido OKAMOTO

sen.j: 鳥辺山心中（とりべやま しんじゅう） 岡本綺堂 作
